title: I really hope Ignite gets nerfed in the near future

replies.body:
Worlds is over.
We can fucking stop with "muh Worlds Meta," now.
I really hope bad players learn to adapt and stop crying about ignite
How do you adapt to ignite?

> [{quoted}](name=Chromatic Eagle,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kGivmmbv,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2018-11-08T16:15:30.678+0000)
>
> How do you adapt to ignite?

By taking zoe and using their ignites as well as your own against them.
https://i.kym-cdn.com/entries/icons/original/000/022/138/ollesafeee.jpg
**# **Sad truth
just take {{summoner:14}} {{summoner:14}} as summoner spells

You are able to do damage calculations and know when it is safe to go all in or not. You can also use Ignite yourself and utilize those calculations for your advantage. Ever since I started playing Aatrox with Ignite, it feels like I always win because he is broken, but I can also calculate my damage to know when to move in and when not to.

ofc you always win when electrocute and ignite take half the HP of anyone. 
All you need to do is literally hit one ability, two autos and use ignite to kill anyone not a bruiser or tank. 
It is ridiculous and people actually believe they are good at the game because they hit two abilities and kill anyone from full health.

Learn to play safer against it, learn to trade against it, learn to anticipate it and learn to invest in correct runes / builds / sustain against it.

And then use the superiority of teleport in 9/10 cases to your advantage.

But that's too difficult of a concept for you, amarite?

Better QQ about it on the forums and let Riot make the game even easier for you :)
How do you play safer against it? How do you trade against it? How do you anticipate it? How do you use runes and builds against it?

How about all those people who:
1) do not use time warp tonic with corrupting potion
2) never use resolve as their secondary options to reduce damage.

Seriously, most people who complain about Ignite are the ones who take Yasuo with Presicion + Domination, have no defensive stats whatsoever and then wonder why the enemy can all-in them at level 2 with Ignite, when they got into lethal because of their bad rune and item choices.
How do you itemize against Ignite?

Since it's true damage, you can itemize into some HP. Literally, a single Ruby Crystal can nullify the entire damage of Ignite until level 7, for example. Well, itemization in this case was more of a general statement about how people are generally disrespectful towards things they could do something about and they instead bitch about it.

How do you justify melee champions not taking resolve secondary when it's really strong?
or maybe just maybe, it never needed to be buffed in the first place and the only reason you care is because your a pantheon main?
Or maybe, just maybe top laners should have a chance to carry the game and shut down the enemy top laner?
and ignite needs to be broken for that to happen why?

Before the buff, Ignite was just terrible. As a top laner, I was NEVER taking Ignite, because it was completely useless, and TP was outclassing it EVERY TIME. Now, after lots of TP nerfs and that Ignite buff, I'm back at picking Ignite. It was healthy. If you still die to Ignite because you don't respect its damage, then you need to learn to play the fucking game.

because ignite was generally a support spell for the heal reduction or an aggressive mid laner spell to win duels and snowball an early lead, it wasnt terrible in the slightest tp SHOULD outclass it top lane to give top more impact on the game instead of being a island unless your a lane bully, which were the type to take ignite top

>_**Just Dodge It**_ ✔️

Amarite?

Learn to play safer against it, learn to trade against it, learn to anticipate it and learn to invest in correct runes / builds / sustain against it. 

And then use the superiority of teleport in 9/10 cases to your advantage. 

But that's too difficult of a concept for you, amarite? 

Better QQ about it on the forums and let Riot make the game even easier for you :)
It's not about adapting or not, we adapted to playing vs 3 ignites per game, that's not the issue, the issue is that is BORING and frustrating to play against it every game.

Boring because you have not learned to play against it.

For me it's boring to play against heal and teleport, the noob spells

Boring because it comes in EVERY GAME, It's not rocket science to play around it. But since heal and teleport to you are "noob" spells, I will leave this conversation now. 

I always thought that damage ignite was the noob spell all along, your facts are world shattering!

> [{quoted}](name=Juice,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kGivmmbv,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-11-08T06:20:10.960+0000)
>
> I really hope bad players learn to adapt and stop crying about ignite

Wow, this is a stupid thing to say. Nice job.

Yeah, it I'll be nerfed together with the unecessary Kha'Zix and Lucian buffs in the future patches.

.
.
.

Hahahahaha, oh no, fuck no, who am I kidding    
      ~~the bs list will keep stacking~~

They should either nerf ign or buff other stuff 5-6 players each game carry a goddamn ignite because it's too good compared to something like barrier that gives 400 shield late game and heal that is insultingly bad and a teleport on 6 mins cd which is straight up joke by riot. How the fuck do u you adapt to true damage at early lvls lol.

Barrier is meant to be outperformed later in the game. It's there to offer survivability through laning phase as it out shields ignite for that entire phase of the game while having a shorter cooldown

> [{quoted}](name=KrakenKnight,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kGivmmbv,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2018-11-08T09:13:56.361+0000)
>
> Barrier is meant to be outperformed later in the game. It's there to offer survivability through laning phase as it out shields ignite for that entire phase of the game while having a shorter cooldown

Barrier only blocks 40% of ignite damage at most at any stage of the game. Barrier only lasts 2 second and ignite last 5 seconds with damage tics every 1.2 seconds after application.
Also that 40% only applies if barrier was active before ignite is applied so in reality its far worse, having ignite yourself is a better counter than barrier if you have any kill potential against the enemy as they have to play less stupid.
Edit: fun fact heal negates 67.5 to 41% of ignites damage.
{{summoner:1}}

> [{quoted}](name=senior evil,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kGivmmbv,comment-id=0002000000000000,timestamp=2018-11-09T00:43:22.204+0000)
>
> {{summoner:1}}

Another summoner doesn't change that fact _**Barrier**_ doesn't counter Ignite.
{{summoner:1}} is the counter not {{summoner:21}}

> [{quoted}](name=KrakenKnight,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kGivmmbv,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2018-11-08T09:13:56.361+0000)
>
> Barrier is meant to be outperformed later in the game. It's there to offer survivability through laning phase as it out shields ignite for that entire phase of the game while having a shorter cooldown

it doesnt out shield ignite though. It only blocks 2 damage ticks from it as barrier only lasts 2 seconds. Heal actually blocks more ignite damage while being halved than barrier does at all stages of the game.

Honestly, Ignite's buff some time ago was necessary, because it was outclassed by EVERY SINGLE summoner spell. The extra damage they gave it is now making it viable and it only catches people off-guard if they are still not used to it by now, which is a very long time. I never really had any problem with Ignite, while I am able to abuse it when I know people can get in lethal range.
Ah yes it was super weak. That's why assassins never took it and why supports never took it at the time.

Teleport is taken on one, MAYBE two champions per game --> It gets nerfed for crowding out other options and being too strong

Ignite is taken on two to three champions per game --> ????
Way too much true damage for just pointing and clicking someone, insane that the buff even went through in the first place.
no.
